task.title: Task: Exploring Tables
task.shortdesc: The two main views of tables: datasheet and design.

taskbody.context:
Tables are the key components of a database, since all data is stored here.The two most important views of a table are
Datasheet View. In this view you can see the contents of the records, change it and also allows you to add new records.
Design View. In this view you can see the design of the table and customize it.

step.stepresult: The Customers table opens in Datasheet View.

step.cmd: Put the table Customers in the Design View on one of the following ways:

choices.choice: Click the button Design View on bottom right of the program window
tab Home View (group Views) Design View .

info.note: You can open a table directly in the Design View by right clicking on the table name in the navigation pane and then choose Design View from the shortcut menu.

step.cmd: Put the table Customers in the Datasheet View again on one of the following ways:

choices.choice: Click the button Datasheet View on the bottom right of the program window
Choose tab Home View (group Views) Datasheet View .

step.cmd: Close the table Customers via the Close button X (top right of the document window).
Open the table Orders in the Datasheet View.
step.tutorialinfo: In the table Orders is a unfold button + in front of the records. By clicking on it you see the details of the order. These data come from the table OrderDetails. That the associated details of a particular order can be found is possible because in both tables the field OrderCode is present.

step.cmd: Click the unfold button at a few records to see which boxes and how much of them are ordered.
